ygData.subject: Re: [neat] Benchmarks?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Derek, I think that private email was to the group BTW :)  Anyway I ll try and respond in full tomorrow, but off the top of my head I would say the 3,6

Hi Derek,

I think that 'private' email was to the group BTW :)  Anyway I'll try 
and respond in full tomorrow, but 'off the top of my head' I would say 
the 3,6 and 11 multiplexer problems I looked at recently are the closest 
to what you want, that I know of. They are easy to code, fast to 
evaluate but require a bit more complexity than pole balancing. I may 
have even stated how much complexity on this list a while ago - anyway 
I'll have to get back to you later on that one.

Colin
